title: Create Art Graphics and Sound Effects
purpose: Describe the core function Create Art Graphics and Sound Effects.
guardrails: Maintain strict adherence to the established art style guide; no off‑brand designs or inconsistent aesthetics
Use only original or properly licensed assets; avoid copyrighted materials
Comply with technical specifications for file formats, resolutions, bit depths, and sound levels
Ensure color palettes meet accessibility and contrast guidelines
Keep audio levels within specified decibel ranges and avoid clipping or distortion
Document all changes and version assets clearly to facilitate tracking
Avoid creating unused assets or over‑scoping beyond what is required for this phase
Stay within the 4–10 week development timeframe and flag risks early

tasks.title: Finalize asset inventory and produce core 2D/3D art, sound, and animation assets.
tasks.description: Finalize the asset inventory and create the core 2D/3D art, sound, and animation assets necessary for the vertical slice.

deliverables.description: Spreadsheet listing all required assets with categories, descriptions, statuses, and assigned artists.

acceptance.text: Inventory covers all assets planned for the vertical slice.
Includes categories (2D, 3D, audio, animation), descriptions, status, and owner.
Reviewed and approved by art and audio leads.

deliverables.description: Zipped package containing finalized core 2D sprites, textures, and 3D models ready for integration.

acceptance.text: Sprites, textures, and 3D models conform to the art style guide.
Files are organized and named according to conventions.
Reviewed by art director.

deliverables.description: Zipped package of final sound effects and music loops for the core gameplay.

acceptance.text: Audio files adhere to licensed or original content and meet technical specifications.
Includes all required sound effects and loops for the vertical slice.
Approved by audio lead.

deliverables.description: Zipped package containing finalized animation files and riggings for characters and environmental effects.

acceptance.text: Animations meet style and technical guidelines.
Files are properly formatted and labeled.
Reviewed by animation lead.

tasks.title: Optimize assets (file size, levels of detail) and integrate into engine.
tasks.description: Optimize the newly created assets for file size and LOD and test their integration in the engine.

deliverables.description: Zipped package of optimized assets (2D, 3D, audio, animation) reducing file sizes and providing multiple levels of detail (LODs).

acceptance.text: Assets meet file size targets for target hardware.
Includes at least two LODs for 3D models.
Quality preserved while optimizing.

deliverables.description: Prototype game build demonstrating that optimized assets load correctly and function properly within the game engine.

acceptance.text: Build loads and displays all optimized assets correctly.
No missing textures or audio clips.
Performance remains within acceptable ranges.

tasks.title: Perform QA checks and update documentation/style guide.
tasks.description: Conduct quality assurance reviews of all assets and update the art style guide accordingly.

deliverables.description: Checklist used to verify each asset against quality criteria, including completion status, naming conventions, and technical compliance.

acceptance.text: Checklist covers all assets and quality criteria.
Entries indicate review status (pass/fail) and notes for fixes.
Completed and signed by QA lead.

deliverables.description: Updated version of the art style guide reflecting any adjustments based on QA findings and asset creation learnings.

acceptance.text: Incorporates lessons learned from QA.
Updates guidelines where necessary.
Approved by art director before finalization.

tasks.title: Package asset bundles and produce an index file.
tasks.description: Bundle the assets into a distribution package and produce an index for easy reference and integration.

deliverables.description: Compressed archive of all prepared assets packaged for distribution and integration.

acceptance.text: Archive decompresses without errors.
Contains all assets needed for vertical slice.
Follows directory structure conventions.

deliverables.description: CSV file indexing each asset with its filename, type, category, version, and relative path in the bundle.

acceptance.text: Lists every asset in the bundle with fields for name, type, category, version, and path.
No missing or duplicate entries.
Parsable by asset management tools.

tasks.title: Gather cross-disciplinary feedback on assets and resolve issues.
tasks.description: Collect and document feedback from other disciplines and resolve asset-related issues accordingly.

deliverables.description: Document summarizing feedback from design, engineering, and production stakeholders on assets and the resolution steps taken.

acceptance.text: Feedback notes capture comments from multiple disciplines with date/time stamps.
Includes resolution status for each issue.
Reviewed and confirmed by asset owners.

deliverables.description: Updated asset library reflecting changes made in response to feedback, ready for final integration.

acceptance.text: Updated library addresses all significant feedback items.
Contains only approved assets.
Organized and ready for integration.

tasks.title: Document changes/version assets clearly for tracking.
tasks.description: Create a versioning log to track modifications to each asset for accountability and future reference.

deliverables.description: Spreadsheet tracking versions of each asset with change descriptions, dates, and author details.

acceptance.text: Versioning log lists each asset with version numbers, change descriptions, dates, and authors.
Shows a clear history of modifications for each asset.
Approved by asset management lead.

tasks.title: Finalize and sign off the asset library for production use.
tasks.description: Deliver the final asset library with sign-offs from leads, signaling readiness for production.

deliverables.description: Final, verified asset library ready for production use after QA and feedback iterations.

acceptance.text: Contains all assets in their final approved form.
No duplicate or unused assets.
Ready for integration into the next development phase.

deliverables.description: Record of final approvals and sign-offs from art, audio, and design leads confirming readiness for production integration.

acceptance.text: Sign-off notes include signatures/approvals from all relevant leads.
Document any outstanding issues or caveats.
Stored in project repository.
